page.title: 01SUMMARY OF STUDY AREA
page.content: The area being studied is principally rural. The major settlement is the village of Send, a ribbon settlement along the Woking/Dorking road, which has expanded with new estates in the Send Marsh and Send Hill areas. A small shopping parade caters for the basic local needs and two bus services connects Send with the shopping centres of Woking (5km) and Guildford (9km) and a nearby service goes to London. Sutton Green is an isolated hamlet with few local amenities and only one local bus service to Woking and Guildford. The church is situated away from the village on Send Hill. Most of the study area is farmed, principally dairy cattle grazing on intensively managed grassland. The River Wey Navigation flows through the area in a south/north direction towards the River Thames at Weybridge.
